The claim specifically mentions that: at least 1,100 eligible voters were wrongly dropped from voting rolls in an attempt to purge a list of felons." This aspect suggests that there was an intentional effort to remove eligible voters from the rolls based on a flawed list.
The claim states that: many of those who were dropped showed up to vote and were told they could not." This aspect suggests that there were instances where individuals who were wrongly dropped from the voting rolls attempted to vote but were denied the opportunity.
The expert: s verdict also mentions that the Obama administration ordered the state to halt the most recent purge on grounds that it violated two voter laws. This aspect suggests that there were legal concerns regarding the methods used in the purge, further questioning its authenticity.
